greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of divisors of 2^n-1.
comment: a(0) cannot be defined because 0's divisors are an infinite set (every number is a divisor of 0.)
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1206 (terms 1..500 from T. D. Noe)
example: a(120) = 73728 since 2^120-1 has that many divisors.
results.author: _Labos Elemer_
ext: Typo in example fixed by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 15 2010
